direction.raw_text: ! Grabner falls back in his chair, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Stan. I'm sure you can find something else for us. How about another crack at that Suicide Hotline? Grabner jumps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HARRY & LLOYD'S APARTMENT - AFTERNOON J.P. Shay is looking through Harry and Lloyd's kitchen cupboards as Joe Mental comes out of the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The briefcase ain't here. He must've taken it with him. J.P. SHAY Shit. (beat) Well he's gotta come home sometime. Joe Mental ominously approaches Petey the parakeet's cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should leave him a little message to let 'em know we're playing hardball. Mental opens the cage door and wraps his meaty fist around the bird, who SCREECHES IN TERROR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a la Tweety Bird) I taut I taw a puddy cat. Mental smiles, and as we PAN to J.P. Shay, we hear a bone- chilling O.S. SNAP and Petey the bird stops SQUAWKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still Tweety) I did, I did...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me what's left of our dough. I'll go to the corner and buy a few necessities. Harry hands his friend some crumpled bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's cheaper, Thunderbird or Night Train?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get Robitussin it's a better buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. CORNER GROCERY STORE - NIGHT Lloyd comes out of the store with his arms full of groceries. He stops at a newspaper machine, pulls out his WALLET and removes a quarter. He drops the quarter in the machine, opens it, and realizes that he DOESN'T HAVE A FREE HAND to pick up the newspaper. He puts his wallet inside the machine, picks up the newspaper, and as he does so THE MACHINE SLAMS SHUT WITH HIS WALLET STILL INSIDE. Lloyd SIGHS, puts his grocery bags on the machine, and checks his pockets. NO MORE CHANGE. Just then, an ELDERLY WOMAN struggles by using a WALKER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, little old lady, do you have change for a dollar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Change? No, I'm sorry, I don't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well could you do me a favor and guard this while I go break a dollar? My wallet's locked in this machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, young man... Lloyd runs back into the store. We HOLD ON THE STORE DOOR as Lloyd EXITS a few seconds later with a handful of quarters. Suddenly he stops in his tracks. The ELDERLY LADY, HER WALKER, AND HIS GROCERIES ARE GONE. As he takes a closer look, he sees that SHE HAS TAKEN HIS WALLET ALSO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. APARTMENT BUILDING STAIRWELL - NIGHT A thoroughly beleaguered Lloyd is trudging empty-handed up the steps to his apartment. INT. LLOYD & HARRY'S APARTMENT The door opens and Lloyd ENTERS. Harry is sitting on the couch, looking almost comatose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the booze?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gone. I got robbed by Grandma Walton. She got my wallet, too. Harry drops his head and lets out a MOAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, man, cheer up. We've been own before. I'm sure we'll land on our heads somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It gets worse, Lloyd. My parakeet Petey he's... he's dead. Lloyd looks touched by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh man, I'm sorry, Harry. What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His head fell off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His head fell off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he was pretty old. Lloyd puts his hand on Harry's shoulder compassionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hopeful) I don't suppose he had a warranty...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, I bought him used. As Lloyd thinks about the unfairness of life, he grows upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it! I've had it with this ump! We don't have food, we don't have jobs, our pets' heads are falling off, we're surrounded by roving gangs of larcenous old LADIES...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I won't calm down. Lloyd flops down in a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are we doing here anyway, Harry? We've got to get out of this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and go where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you where: someplace warm, a place where the beer flows like wine, where beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. (dramatic PAUSE) I'm talking about Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aspen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Lloyd, the French are assholes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me ask you something: do you want to end up like Petey dead in some flea-ridden apartment, face- down on a Dear Abby column, with a soggy sunflower seed pressed against your beak? Or do you want to enjoy your life? (beat) Come on, Harry, don't let Petey's eath be in vain. Don't you see what he was saying? Spread your wings, man. he was saying? Spread your wings, man. Fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused) What are you talking about, Lloyd? His head fell off. (dawning realization) Wait a second, I know what you're up to. You just wanna go to Aspen so you can find that girl who lost her briefcase and you need me to drive you there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's bullshit. I'll drive. (beat) And what's so wrong about going someplace where we know someone who can plug us into the social pipeline?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (torn) I don't know, Lloyd. I think we should stay here, hunt for jobs, and keep saving money for the worm store. I'm getting a little sick and tired of always running from creditors. Lloyd moves to the window and looks out at the gray, wintry cityscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I'm sick and tired of, Harry? I'm sick and tired of having to eek my way through life. I'm sick and tired of being a nobody. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) But most of all, I'm sick and tired of having nobody. There's a deadly SILENCE as they both think about this. Then Harry tries to lighten the mood. He opens his arms wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Lloyd. Give us a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other hand, maybe you're right, Harry. Maybe we should stay here and try our luck in bankruptcy court. With all those lawsuits against us, I'm sure we'll win at least one. It could be a boost to our egos. Harry sees that Lloyd has a point. He stands and approaches Petey's cage. His eyes fill with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (emotional) Petey, I made a promise to you once, man... (thinking hard) ...and I'll be damned if I can remember what it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY The Mutt Cutts van is going down the highway while Danny Wilson's "Mary's Prayer" plays on the soundtrack. The van drives past and we HOLD ON a sign that reads: "YOU ARE LEAVING PROVIDENCE, RHODE ISLAND. COME BACK SOON." VARIOUS OTHER AERIAL SHOTS of the car travelling down the road while the song continues to play. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - DAY Harry's behind the wheel and Lloyd's in the passenger seat. The Animal's "We've Got to Get Out of This Place" is BLASTING on the radio and the guys are SINGING ALONG: 19.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "We've got to get out of this place, If it's the last thing we ever do, We've got to get out of this place, Girl, there's a better life, for me and you..." Lloyd turns down the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're finally doing it. Do you realize that in all the years we've known each other, this is the first time we've done this together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been run out of town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taken a trip. Harry reaches over and UNDOES HIS SEATBELT. Lloyd watches, curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your seatbelt off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we just cleared the danger zone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know anything, Lloyd? Ninety percent of all accidents happen within five miles of home. We've already traveled 6.3 miles. LLOYD THINKS ABOUT THIS. THEN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what about the people who live around here? What if we got into an accident with one of them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Harry considers this, then sheepishly puts his seatbelt back on. Lloyd opens a bag of Doritos and fiddles with the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get those?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bought 'em when we filled up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lloyd, I thought we agreed to confer on all expenditures. We're on a tight budget, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This didn't come out of our travel fund. I was able to scrape up twenty- five bucks before we left. You know, so we could live in style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get twenty-five extra bucks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sold some stuff to Billy in 4-C.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the blind kid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. Lloyd looks out the window guiltily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you sell him, Lloyd?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just some odds and ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Specifically?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, a few baseball cards, a sack of marbles, Petey, three comic books a second, are you telling me you sold my dead bird to a blind kid? Well who else was I gonna sell it to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Lloyd, Petey didn't even have a head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put your mind at ease, friend. I took care of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY At the bottom of the stairs leading up to the building is a little blind boy, BILLY. He sits in a wheelchair playing with a PARAKEET WHOSE HEAD IS SCOTCH-TAPED ON. He throws the ead bird up, but it flops into his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fly! Joe Mental and J.P. Shay approach and climb the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : CLOSE ON A NOTE - taped to Harry and Lloyd's apartment door. It reads: TO ALL OUR LOVED ONES - PACKED UP AND DROVE TO ASPEN - HAVE A NICE LIFE - LLOYD AND HARRY. PULLBACK to reveal Joe Mental and J.P. Shay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those bastards. They're rubbing it right in our faces. J.P. SHAY Shit! Andre will have a goddamn aneurysm if we don't get that briefcase back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't   worry, we'll get it back. And I'll   tell you something else. They ain't   gonna reach Aspen, either. I'll   make sure of that. Mental takes out more ANTACID PILLS and starts to chew on them. EXT. APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY A pissed-off Shay and Mental EXIT the building. Mental pops more antacid pills into his mouth as they descend the stairs. Little Billy is still tossing the lifeless parakeet into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, boy, fly! Plop. Then Billy hears Shay and Mental on the steps and CALLS OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, mister. Is there something wrong with my bird? Mental picks up the bird, studies it, then angrily and WINGS IT DOWN THE STREET as hard as he can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, Ironside, he just flew south for the winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - AFTERNOON Harry is still driving while Lloyd studies a map spread out before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far have we gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to this map, about an inch and a half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. We're gonna need a smaller map or we'll never get there. We don't have enough gas money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. We have more than enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you're wrong, Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I believe I'm right, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still say wrong, Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much you wanna bet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lloyd looks at his friend, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean you don't bet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean I don't gamble, you know that. Never have and never will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, bull. I'll bet you our next meal that I can get you gambling before the day's out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way, Lloyd. You can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you three-to-one odds. That's three feedbags if you win, against only one if you lose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wasting your money, Lloyd. I already told you, I don't gamble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, five-to-one I can get you gambling before the day's out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, pal, no way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it ten-to-one. Harry sticks out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got yourself a bet, sucker! As Harry SHAKES LLOYD'S HAND, Lloyd breaks into a BIG SMILE. Harry immediately realizes he's been had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. TRUCK STOP CAFE - AFTERNOON The Mutt Cutt van is sandwiched between mountainous tractor- trailer trucks. 24. INT. TRUCK STOP CAFE Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a booth, surrounded by tables of tough-looking TRUCKERS. Harry oesn't look happy. A middle- aged, no-nonsense WAITRESS approaches their table with a couple of burgers and drinks. She puts them down in front of the boys and starts to walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Waitress) UH, EXCUSE ME... The Waitress reluctantly returns to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the soup du jour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the soup-of-the-day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds tasty. I'll have a bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Anything else before I leave the area?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, this chocolate milk isn't mixed very well. Could you please bring me a spoon? The Waitress SIGHS and picks up the milk. Then she BLOWS INTO THE STRAW, MIXING THE DRINK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. Now you don't need one. The guys watch her stomp away. LLOYD FEELS GOOD TO MINGLE WITH THESE LAID- back country-folk, don't it, Harry? Harry wipes off his straw with a napkin. As he moves to put it in the ashtray, he accidentally KNOCKS OVER THE SALT SHAKER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spilled the salt. That's bad luck. We're driving across the country and the last thing we need is bad luck. Quick, toss a handful of salt over your right shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because that's good luck. Harry shrugs, shakes some salt into his palm, and flings it over his shoulder. Suddenly they hear a YELP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) What the fuck?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or was it the left shoulder? They turn and see a burly TRUCKER wiping salt out of his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the dead man threw shit in my eye? The huge Trucker stands and squints at Lloyd and Harry. He's wearing a FOAM BASEBALL CAP that says: WINE 'EM, DINE 'EM, SIXTY-NINE 'EM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a terrible accident, Sir. Believe me, I would never do anything to offend a man of your size. Please accept my most sincere apology. The Trucker GROWLS and approaches the table, egged on by his equally burly FRIENDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teach him a lesson, Sea Bass!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sea Bass glares down at Harry's hamburger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna eat that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... the thought had crossed my mind. At this, Sea Bass leans over and DROPS A BIG, BROWN WAD OF TOBACCO SPIT ONTO THE HAMBURGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still want it? Harry stares at the burger non-commitally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, you go ahead. Sea Bass picks up the burger and walks back to his table, to the LAUGHTER of his friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. TRUCK STOP CAFE - AFTERNOON J.P. Shay is at the gas pump filling the black Cadillac while Joe Mental stretches his legs. A large truck pulls away, REVEALING THE PREVIOUSLY HIDDEN MUTT CUTTS VAN. Mental smiles at this, and we CUT TO: INT. TRUCK STOP CAFE The Waitress drops the check on Lloyd and Harry's table and STOMPS away. Harry studies the bill and SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perfect. I'm out eight bucks and I still haven't eaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if you'd stop picking fights with the locals... (brightening) Wait a second. I think I just had an idea. Follow me... Lloyd stands and walks over to Sea Bass and his pals. A nervous Harry trails after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, gentlemen, I'd just like to apologize for that unpleasant scene a little earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm trying to say is, my friend and I would like to buy you guys a round of beers, just to bury the hatchet. Harry stares at Lloyd like he's out of his mind, but the Truckers seem to like the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make it four boiler-makers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you want, sir. I'll have the waitress send them over. Oh, and fellas hope to see you again down the road. Lloyd and Harry move away from the table toward the CASHIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lloyd, what are you doing? You know we can't afford to buy them drinks. Lloyd hands the Cashier their check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, Sea Bass and the fellas offered to pick up our check. They said just add this to their tab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (skeptical) Sea Bass said that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if that guy at the table over there is Sea Bass... He points across the room to Sea Bass and company. Sea Bass NODS TO THE CASHIER AND GESTURES TO HIS TABLE, NOT WANTING TO MISS OUT ON HIS FREE DRINK. The Cashier is convinced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okey-dokey, if that's what he wants...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Harry smiles at this. He grabs a couple Beef Jerky's, a candy bar, and a copy of The National Enquirer off the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and put these on there, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Cashier) By the way, how far is it to Rhode Island from here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. TRUCK STOP CAFE - AFTERNOON The front door BURSTS OPEN and a red-faced Sea Bass STORMS OUT, followed by his buddies, the Cashier, and the Waitress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna kill those sons-of-bitches!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry and you'll catch 'em. They was on their way to Rhode Island. The Truckers jump in their rigs and RUMBLE AWAY   in the OPPOSITE DIRECTION our boys are headed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - AFTERNOON The Mutt Cutts van breezes by. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - AFTERNOON A jubilant Harry's driving and chewing on a mouthful of Beef Jerky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wish we could've seen Sea Bass's face when he got the bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope we never have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. That fish-head is probably half-way to Providence by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope so. Harry checks his rear-view mirror nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, stop the car. I gotta take a whiz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? I'm not stopping now. What if they figure out we went the other way. They'll be on us in no time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I gotta go. What am I supposed to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't hold it. I'm about to explode.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... just take a whiz in an empty beer bottle. There's a couple on the floor in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I'm serious. I'm not stopping now. We could get killed. Lloyd SIGHS. He takes an EMPTY BEER BOTTLE from the back seat and UNZIPS his fly. Suddenly we hear a PEEING SOUND. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bottle's almost full and I'm still going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well stop going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't stop once I already started, you know that. Quick, get me another bottle. Harry can BARELY HOLD THE STEERING WHEEL as he reaches way in the back seat for an empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, be careful! You almost went off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Lloyd. I'm doing the best I can. He hands Lloyd another empty and Lloyd quickly makes the switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, hold this. Before Harry knows it he's holding the full BOTTLE OF URINE. EXT. HIGHWAY - LATE DAY As the Mutt Cutts van travels down the highway, it passes a STATE TROOPER on a motorcycle hidden in the bushes. The Trooper takes off after them. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN Harry is doing his best to steer while now holding FIVE FULL BOTTLES AND Lloyd is still going at it in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, a goddamn camel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I haven't gone all day. Just then they hear a LOUDSPEAKER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) Pull over! They turn to see the POLICE MOTORCYCLE cruising right beside then. Harry rolls down his window and CALLS OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Harry glances down at his sweater he's wearing, then back at the Trooper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling out) No, it's a Cardigan! But thanks for noticing! He rolls his window back up and turns to an equally baffled Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, what is this, the fashion police? The Cop turns on his SIREN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - LATE DAY The STATE TROOPER is walking up beside the stopped Mutt Cutts van, staring at it with isapproval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: License and registration, please. Harry hands him the papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you fellas were all over the road back there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir, we had a little... ifficulty in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh. (beat) Have you boys been doing a little rinking maybe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what's that? He points to the OPEN, FULL BEER BOTTLES hidden in the seat between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's nothing, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know it's against the law to rive with an open alcohol container in this state?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, your honor, he's telling the truth. It's not beer. The officer smirks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that right? The Trooper reaches in and picks up one of the bottles. He inspects the beer label, then MOVES THE BOTTLE TO HIS LIPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I wouldn't TROOPER --You'd keep your mouth shut if you knew what was good for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under breath) YOU WOULD, TOO... Harry shoots Lloyd a look as the Trooper begins GULPING down the piss. He pauses uncertainly and a SICK LOOK COMES OVER HIS FACE. He takes a DEEP BREATH. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pained) Get the hell out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Mutt Cutts van is pulling back onto the highway while the officer remains in the breakdown lane with his hands on his knees. CUT TO: 33. EXT. HIGHWAY - NIGHT The van is making steady progress through the dark night. INT. MUTT CUTT VAN - NIGHT Lloyd is driving now while Harry sleeps in the passenger seat. The song, "Cut Flowers" by The Smithereens, starts to play as Lloyd FANTASIZES about his future in Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (v.o.) How does that feel, Lloyd?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) How's the other side?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Nothing at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) Lloyd, will you wash my nipples...? ON MARY - her   hair is slicked back, making her look better than ever. As   the CAMERA PANS DOWN toward her breasts, we are surprised   to see not breasts but a SET OF HEADLIGHTS SUPERIMPOSED   OVER HER CHEST AREA. The headlights FLASH ONCE. Then TWICE. ON LLOYD - he blinks, confused at what's happening. JUMP CUT   TO - an eighteen-wheeler is ROARING RIGHT TOWARD THE MUTT   CUTTS VAN on the highway. Lloyd quickly veers back into his   lane and avoids tragedy by a whisker. A shaken Lloyd lets out   a SIGH OF RELIEF, and we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. SECOND HONEYMOON HOTEL - NIGHT The Mutt Cutts van is parked outside this seedy establishment. A neon sign blinks: GROUP DISCOUNTS - HAVE YOUR NEXT AFFAIR HERE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (v.o.) I don't know, Lloyd, I feel a little sleazy staying here when we're not even engaged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (v.o.) Hey, it's the only motel that charges by the hour. We can't afford anything else. INT. BATHROOM - SECOND HONEYMOON MOTEL Lloyd and Harry are sitting in a large, HEART-SHAPED JACUZZI. Lloyd is sipping a beer and Harry is absorbed in the Enquirer as the water swirls around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep, this sure is the life. Cold beer, a hot tube, and fuzzy pink sheets... You know, there's only one thing that could make this moment any better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you had a nice set of knockers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's two things, Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now I'd settle for one. Lloyd takes a swig of beer. Harry puts down the paper and looks around at the romantic decor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Lloyd, these places just don't do it for me. Brings back too many memories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened, Harry? Some little filly break your heart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, it was a girl. Fraida Felcher. We stayed at a place like this once No-Tell Motel out on Route 31.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Felcher? You mean the babe who worked for the tractor company? Harry nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same. We had this incredibly romantic time. Boy, I thought we'd be together forever. (SIGHS) Then about a week later, right out of the blue, she sends me a John Deere letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's cold, Har. Give you any reason?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called her up and she gave me some crap about me not listening to her enough or something like that. I wasn't really paying attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Harry reaches for a beer and busts it open. He takes a big gulp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thing that really hurts is I think she was seeing another guy. Never id find out who. ON LLOYD - he does his best to hide his GUILT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. SECOND HONEYMOON MOTEL - NIGHT We see that the black Cadillac is   parked a few cars over from the Mutt Cutts van with J.P.   Shay in the passenger seat. PAN OVER to a payphone. Inside is   Joe Mental. Outside the booth, an ANXIOUS MAN impatiently   paces back and forth as he waits for the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) The boys are holed-up in a little love nest for the night. I think they're a couple of fucking weirdos. INT. NICHOLAS ANDRE'S STUDY - NIGHT NICHOLAS ANDRE is pacing around the room with a cordless phone. He's in his late 30s, wears a ponytail, and dresses in Aspen/Rodeo Drive chic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in hell are those guys up to? Is it possible that they're Feds? INTERCUT CONVERSATION MENTAL Unlikely from what I've seen. The ANXIOUS MAN taps on the phone booth and motions for Mental to hang up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like this one goddamn bit, Mental. You and Shay were supposed to grab that bag so we could end this shit. Now I don't know what the hell's going on. Andre SIGHS and wipes some perspiration from his upper lip. The Anxious Man KNOCKS on the booth again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on a second, Mr. Andre... Mental puts the phone down and motions the    Anxious Man closer to the booth. The Man moves forward a few    inches. Mental motions him even closer. When he's about a    foot away, Mental punches his hand through the glass of the    booth and knocks the Anxious Man out cold. Then Mental picks up the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, boss. You were saying...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mental, just find out what they're up to. I want to know who these guys are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. I'm on it. Mental hangs up the phone, looks around to make sure he's not being watched, then approaches the parked Mutt Cutt van. He's joined by J.P. Shay. As they get within five feet of the vehicle, we hear a LOW GROWL. They stop in their tracks and turn, expecting to see a dog but there isn't one. They both take another step forward, and the GROWL GETS LOUDER AND MEANER. Again, Mental and Shay stop. He peeks under the car. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck...? Finally, Shay reaches for the door handle. As soon as he touches it, though, the car alarm goes off but instead of a siren, it's the incredibly annoying sound of a POODLE YAPPING. Mental jumps back and pulls his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the goddamn dog? Shay shrugs, nervous. The YAPPING grows EVEN LOUDER now, forcing a flustered Shay and Mental to retreat from the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. SWANSON CHALET - ASPEN - NIGHT ESTABLISHING SHOT of a luxurious mountainside home. 38. INT. LIVING ROOM - SWANSON CHALET An agitated Mary Swanson (the young woman who lost her briefcase) is pacing back and forth in AN IMPRESSIVE, ANTIQUE-FILLED LIVING ROOM. SEATED ON A COUCH ARE HER FATHER KARL AND HIS MUCH- younger second wife, HELEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just doesn't make any sense. I left the money exactly where they instructed me to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, it makes a great deal of sense, Mary. We should have called in the authorities the moment we knew Melvin had been kidnapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Helen, we've been through this already for Christ's sake, Karl, these bastards will extort us into bankruptcy if we let them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'd never forgive myself if something happened to Melvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop upsetting my daughter, Helen. She's been through quite enough already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not her fault, Daddy. We're all a little on edge. Just then the living room door opens and the pony tailed Nicholas Andre ENTERS. He looks appropriately solemn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has there been any word, Mr. Swanson?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing yet, Nicholas. Andre looks upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps I should call off the Preservation benefit this weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IT WOULD BE EASY ENOUGH TO RE- schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Nicholas, it's imperative that we carry on as usual. The atmosphere in the room couldn't be more somber. Karl Swanson holds his hand out to his aughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, sweetheart. I'll do everything they ask. Nothing's going to happen to Melvin, I promise you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Daddy. Karl Swanson looks out the window, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY The black Cadillac pulls over to the side of the road. Joe Mental gets out of the car and props the hood open. He takes out his gun, SLIDES IN A NEW CLIP, and puts it back in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Shay) Lie down on the front seat. After they pick me up I want you to follow us. Then he folds his arms and the two killers wait for the van to come along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - DAY Lloyd taps Harry's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're it. Harry taps Lloyd back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're it. Lloyd immediately taps Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're it. Quitsies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tapping him back) Anti-quitsies. You're it. Quitsies. No anti-quitsies. No startsies. Lloyd shakes his head, defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, you're good, Harry. (beat) Hey, didn't I tell you this trip would be a blast? EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY Joe Mental squints down the road, sees the Mutt Cutts van approaching, and starts WAVING HIS HANDS to flag them down. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN Through the windshield we can see Mental waving. The guys don't slow down, through. The just WAVE BACK as they BLOW RIGHT BY HIM. Harry also toots the horn, which makes the SOUND OF A DOG BARKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I told you these country folks were friendly, Harry. EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY As an angry Mental watches them disappear down the road, Shay sits up in the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These fuckers are really pissing me off now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - LATER THAT DAY We hear The Zombie's 'Time of the Season' as the van flashes by. 41. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - DAY HARRY Refresh my memory on something, Lloyd: what exactly do we do when we get to Aspen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well the first thing we do is take a good deep breath of that famous Aspenese air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fresh, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The freshest. They say on any day of the week you can smell a moose-fart ten miles away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sincere) Wow... talk about paradise. (beat) And after we're finished breathing, what next, Lloyd?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we make a splash on the social scene. Just then, Lloyd notices something up the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, look the golden arches. Pull over, I'm starving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MCDONALD'S - DAY The Mutt Cutt car is at the drive-through window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...That's two cheese burgers, two fries, and two medium Cokes. Five seventy- two. Harry hands a ten-dollar-bill to the Employee, who returns a handful of change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then, before he can  give them   the bag of food, the guys absentmindedly DRIVE  OFF. As   they pull out of the parking lot, the McDonald's  Employee   sticks his head out the window and WAVES THE BAG OF  FOOD at   them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! But the guys are already around the corner. EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY The Mutt Cutt van is on the road again, cruising along. INT. MUTT CUTT VAN - DAY HARRY About this social scene how do you expect a couple mutts like us to make a splash in the land of pedigrees when we don't even have any money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, once we drop the briefcase off to Mary, she'll be so grateful she'll plug us right into the party circuit. After that, we do a little of the ski SCENE, HOB-NOB WITH THE ELBOW- rubbers, and walk out of there in the spring with enough business connections to open a first-class worm operation. You see, you don't get rich working, Harry. You get rich knowing the rich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some bum down at unemployment. Harry thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money does terrible things to people. I mean, we could lose our friendship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lloyd thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? So? Harry nods and looks out the window. Suddenly SOMETHING DAWNS ON LLOYD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, wait a second. Hold everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you forgetting something? Harry thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back at Mickey D's? A little matter you might've overlooked...? Harry wracks his brain, but to no avail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Lloyd rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My change. As a sheepish Harry gives Lloyd his change, they notice something up ahead. HARRY & LLOYD'S POV - ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD, JOE MENTAL IS WAVING THEM DOWN AGAIN. This time the Cadillac is PARKED SIDEWAYS ACROSS THE ROAD, BLOCKING THEIR PATH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think this guy's in trouble. Why on't you pull over. Lloyd looks at Harry. Harry remembers that he's driving. He pulls the car to the side of the road. Mental approaches the passenger window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys going as far as Des Moines? My car died and I'm late for a business meeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - DAY They're back on the highway and Joe Mental is SITTING BETWEEN THEM, looking extremely ANNOYED. The guys are in the middle of an argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a fruit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a vegetable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you, it's a fruit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I happen to know it's a vegetable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell you what, why don't we leet an impartial judge decide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine with me. Harry turns to Joe Mental.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mr. Mentalino, settle our bet: Are jelly beans fruits or vegetables? Mental grits his teeth as he pops a few antacid pills in his mouth. He reaches into his coat pocket and we see a GLINT OF STEEL. Just when he's about to pull the gun out, though, Lloyd hits the breaks and SKIDS to a stop beside a bunch of hitchhiking MIGRANT WORKERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - LATER The trio have picked up SIX MIGRANT WORKERS and everyone is crammed into the car including a CRYING BABY who sits on a pissed-off Mental's lap. Someone's playing a FLAMENCO GUITAR and the gang is SINGING a SPANISH SONG. DISSOLVE TO: 45. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - LATER STILL The Migrant Family is gone now. Harry and Lloyd are playing a game while Mental stares straight ahead, furious. His eyes are watering and he looks ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Harry, my turn. Let 'er rip. Harry lifts a cheer and lets out a LOUD FART. Lloyd SNIFFS a few times, then closes his eyes and WAFTS it up toward his nostrils, as if it was the aroma of a fine wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm... full-bodied, delicate bouquet, aged to perfection will rip no fart before it's time. (beat) Come on, Marquis of Dingleberry's rules: you got ten seconds. All right. I'll say: cheese doodles, chili dog extra onions, garden salad with blue...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit-Kat bar. Harry throws up his arms, defeated. He hands Lloyd a buck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the best, man. (beat) Okay, my turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are your manners, Harry? We have a guest. Harry punches Mental's shoulder playfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Mr. Mentalino. Let one fly. It's only a buck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. DANTE'S INFERNO CAFE - LATE AFTERNOON A large neon road sign beside the cafe shows a man's exasperated face with FLAMES SHOOTING FROM HIS NOSE, MOUTH AND EARS. The sign advertises: HOTTEST CHILI 46. PEPPERS NORTH OF THE BORDER. INT. DANTE'S INFERNO Lloyd and Harry are sitting at a table with a hateful Joe Mental. The boys are each holding up a POINTED RED CHILI PEPPER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do one if you will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you go first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you both stop being a couple of pussies and go at the same time. It ain't that hot. Lloyd and Harry exchange a look, then simultaneously BITE INTO THE PEPPERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm, not bad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, more tingly than hot. Suddenly the boys' EYES LIGHT UP. THEY LET OUT A SHRIEK. A smile begins to curl on Mental's lips. He pours them a couple glasses of water from a pitcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have some water. It'll help. Lloyd and Harry who are both sweating profusely now start to GULP down their water. This, of course, makes it burn more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, shucks, that's right. Water just makes it worse... The boys run to the bar and DUMP PITCHERS OF WATER ON THEIR HEADS, much to the elight of a CHUCKLING Joe Mental.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 47. EXT. DANTE'S INFERNO - DAY Mental is on the phone outside the front door TALKING to Nicholas Andre. INTERCUT CONVERSATION MENTAL It's Mental. I'm just sitting down to a nice meal with our boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work. What did you find out so far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing yet, but I'm gonna shake 'em own for information at lunch. (beat) Then I'm gonna kill 'em for dessert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well eat fast, time's running out. And whatever you do, don't let them get any closer. I don't need them here running around Aspen. Mental pulls a BLACK VIAL OF PILLS out of his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, they ain't gonna be running around anywhere after I dump a little cyanide in their pops. INT. DANTE'S INFERNO - DAY Back at the table, the boys are soaked and HUFFING as if they just finished the Boston Marathon. The burgers have been served, but Lloyd and Harry are still too traumatized to touch them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That really wasn't very polite of him, was it? Maybe we should loosen the screws of his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry Dunne, I'm surprised at you. Perhaps it's about time you brushed UP ON A LITTLE TOME THAT WE GOD- fearing adults call the Bible. It's crammed with all kinds of pithy rules to live your life by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (humbled) You mean like 'turn the other cheek?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I mean like 'an eye for an eye.' Hand me those peppers the atomic ones. Harry passes the jar and the two of them LOAD JOE MENTAL'S BURGER WITH CHILI PEPPERS, EXPERTLY CAMOUFLAGING THEM WITH LETTUCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) Here he comes. Lloyd and Harry bite into their food as Joe Mental sits back down at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feeling any better, boys? As he pours ketchup on his burger, the guys glance at each other and TITTER. Then he picks it up and brings it to his mouth. Just before biting into it, though, he PAUSES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me, why you fellas headed to Aspen? Vacation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More like re-location. Mental starts toward the burger but stops again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't look like you packed much. All I saw was a couple bags... and that briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The briefcase isn't even ours. Some lady just left it at the airport. We're bringing it back to her. This is news to Mental.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you don't even know her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. I was just her limo river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mental looks at the two of them and realizes that they're serious. Then he BREAKS OUT LAUGHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk about being in the wrong place at the wrong time... Lloyd and Harry share a     confused look. Mental shakes his head and BITES INTO HIS     BURGER, CHEWING HEARTILY. Almost immediately, his happy     demeanor is replaced by a LOOK OF HORROR. His FACE TURNS     RED, HE GRABS HIS STOMACH AND FALLS TO THE GROUND, GASPING. The boys look at each other guiltily, then bend down to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you okay, man? It was just a goof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ulcer... quick... pills... in my coat... Harry checks Mental's coat pocket        for his antacid pills but unwittingly brings out the BLACK        OF CYANIDE PILLS. He shakes some pills out and hands them to        Mental, who tosses them in his mouth and starts to MUNCH on        them. For a moment, he appears to improve. His BREATHING SLOWS and he sits up. Then his EYES LIGHT UP. MENTAL'S POV - QUICK ZOOM IN on the black bottle Harry is holding!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son-of-a-bitch! Mental GURGLES and keels over, DEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - AFTERNOON Lloyd and Harry are back on the road, looking solemn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life is a fragile thing, Har. One minute you're chewing on a burger; the next minute you're dead meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he blamed me. You heard him. Those were his last words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't count that gurgling sound. Harry lets out a GROAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, relax, man, I'm just as responsible as you are we both slipped him the peppers and look at me, I on't feel guilty at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small comfort coming from a man who sells dead birds to blind kids. (SIGHS) Don't you get it, Lloyd. I've got a ead guy pissed at me. His restless spirit will probably haunt me for the next seventy-five years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ridiculous. You probably won't live to see forty. Harry perks up, cheered by this thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. (beat) Wow. What a relief. EXT. HIGHWAY - AFTERNOON As the Mutt Cutts van flashes by on it's westward journey, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. DANTE'S INFERNO - EVENING A DOCTOR is covering up the body of Joe Mental as he TALKS to DETECTIVE DALE. The etective is a no-nonsense type in his mid-forties with a military-regulation crewcut. 51.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...My official conclusion is that the eceased expired from oxygen eprivation caused by the presence of cyanide in the bloodstream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean he was poisoned?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unquestionably. We found these by the body. He holds up the container of cyanide pills. Dt. Dale nods and approaches another COP in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waitress says he was with a couple of younger guys. They're the ones who called the ambulance then they hit the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any idea where they were going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A witness at the next table thought he heard them say they were driving to France. Dale frowns at this and the Cop shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a report they were seen heading west on I-80 toward Colorado.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a make on the vehicle? The Cop consults his note pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. They were driving an '84 poodle. Dt. Dale does a double-take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An '84 what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (straight-faced) Well it might have been a wire-haired terrier, Detective. They're very similar in appearance. The Detective looks confused, as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - NIGHT The boys are extremely exhausted as they plow through the black night toward Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get off and crash at a motel before I crash into one. (yawning) I need a crib fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Har. We're gonna have to hold out. Seems we misjudged our expense allocation. If we pay for a motel we won't have enough for gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to the dough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We over-leveraged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sprung for Mr. Chili Pepper's last meal. Felt it was the least we could o after we deep-sixed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second one burger put us over budget?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The slob ordered a double-bacon eluxe and a chocolate malt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. (beat) So what are we gonna do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drive. We've only got ten more hours. We can take turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. DANTE'S INFERNO - PHONE BOOTH - NIGHT A frightened J.P. Shay is TALKING on the phone with Nicholas Andre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me, he's dead. The bastards killed him. INT. NICHOLAS ANDRE'S STUDY - NIGHT Andre nervously lights a cigarette as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ... Andre's forehead begins to glisten with perspiration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I want you back here now. If they're coming this way I'm going to need you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (v.o.) How's our bankroll doing? Giving you a hard time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin's not the problem. It's these two other guys that have me worried. I wish I knew what the hell they wanted. Andre hangs up the phone and then disappears down his basement stairs. INT. BASEMENT - NIGHT The room has a dirt floor. There's a stone WELL in the middle. We hear MUFFLED HUMAN WHIMPERING coming from deep within the well. Andre walks to the edge of the dark hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doing today, Melvin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Andre takes a hit off his cigarette and flicks it into the well. CUT TO: EXT. HIGHWAY - NIGHT The Mutt Cutts van cruises down the lonely interstate. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - NIGHT Lloyd is now FAST ASLEEP in the passenger seat as Harry drives on. A roadsign reading DENVER - 602 MILES whizzes by. Todd Rundgren's "Too Far Gone" begins to play while Harry peers at the empty highway INTROSPECTIVELY. As the song plays we see a series of quick shots: A new sign says DENVER - 421 MILES. Lloyd is still asleep with his feet now on Harry's lap. Another sign reads DENVER - 201 MILES. Harry stares straight ahead, practically catatonic. Lloyd's feet are out the window and his head is on Harry's lap. The next roadsign says DENVER - 157 MILES. Lloyd's feet are now up over the headrest and his head is down where his feet should be. Harry looks on the verge of blacking out. Finally, a sign reads COLORADO STATE LINE - 25 MILES/FOOD, GAS NEXT EXIT. EXT. TRUCK STOP - 2:10 IN THE MORNING The Mutt Cutts van pulls up to a gas pump. In the background are several tractor-trailer rigs and a cafe. Harry climbs out, thoroughly exhausted, walks around and opens the passenger door. Lloyd tumbles to the asphalt, STILL ASLEEP. Harry nudges him with his foot.

Terrified, Lloyd quickly locks the stall door, then crouches on the toilet bowl so his feet aren't visible. The sound of HEAVY FOOTSTEPS approaches the stall and then stops. Lloyd looks down to see a pair of SIZE 16 WORKBOOTS beneath the door. We can barely hear a LOW GROWL. Then the stall handle JIGGLES. Lloyd holds his breath. The ominous boots MOVE AWAY and Lloyd lets out a SIGH OF RELIEF. All of a sudden the DOOR IS KICKED IN, AND A TOWERING FIGURE STEPS INTO FRAME. Lloyd looks up and GASPS. direction.raw_text: Actually, I'm moving to Aspen. I've got to get away from my boyfriend. He's such a klutz. My astrologer told me I should avoid accident-prone guys. direction.raw_text: (desperate) Positive please hurry. He begins hopping around violently.

In his desperation he PLOWS THROUGH THE STALL DOOR KNOCKING SEA BASS ON THE HEAD and thrusts his flaming foot into the toilet, EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE. Harry breathes a DEEP SIGH of relief. Only then does he notice LLOYD ON HIS KNEES AND SEA BASS UNCONSCIOUS ON THE FLOOR WITH HIS PANTS UNDONE. Harry has to do a DOUBLE-TAKE for this to sink in. Then he lets out an admonishing WHISTLE.

direction.raw_text: You've got some serious explaining to o, young man.

direction.name: direction

A HELICOPTER lands on the side of the  road and Detective Dale hops out. He hurries to the COP in  charge.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MINI MART - NIGHT ESTABLISHING SHOT of a mini mart. INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - NIGHT The door opens and Lloyd gets in carrying a bag of Doritos and a soda. He settles into the driver's seat and pulls a Beef Jerky out of his back pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I picked you up a Beef Jerky... When he gets no response, he notices that Harry is already fast asleep in the passenger seat. Lloyd shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, some guys just weren't cut out for life on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - NIGHT Lloyd starts the engine and    pulls out of the parking lot to the nearby freeway entrance.    As he enters the on-ramp, we ZOOM IN on a sign that says:    ROUTE 80 - EAST. He's unwittingly headed BACK IN THE DIRECTION    THEY JUST CAME FROM! DISSOLVE TO: INT. MUTT CUTTS VAN - SUNNY MORNING It's bright daylight now. Harry is sleeping peacefully in the passenger seat while Lloyd sips a coffee. The van hits a bump which causes Harry's eyes to flutter open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Mr. Sleepy Head, welcome back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (groggy) How long have I been out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say a good five hours, anyway. Harry yawns and stretches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. We must be getting real close, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should be. I've been averaging about ninety miles an hour all night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, I'll tell you, this is one angerous highway. You wouldn't believe all the road pizza two dead ogs, a couple of rabbits, a snake and some big thing I couldn't even recognize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's awful. Did you see them get hit or were they already lying there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hit 'em. Harry rubs his eyes and looks at the passing FLATLANDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny. I expected the Rocky Mountains to be a little rockier than this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking the same thing. That John Denver's some full of shit, huh? They both stare out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must say, Des Moines sure is a pretty little town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it really is. (beat) Wait a minute when did you visit Des Moines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night. We drove through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? You were snoring like a baby when we went through Des Moines. Lloyd shakes his head in amusement, then SNAPS HIS FINGERS in Harry's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sing-song) Hello? Hello? Anybody home? Rise and shine. (LAUGHS) You were the one who was asleep, numbskull. Here, take a sip of coffee. You're delirious. A confused Harry sips the coffee and checks out the passing terrain. Then something starts to awn on him. Slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Lloyd, refresh my memory: Doesn't the sun rise in the east and set in the west?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In our country it does, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then perchance you can explain to me why the sun is in our face at 7:30 in the morning when we're heading west. Lloyd thinks about this and then looks SICKENED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. TRUCKSTOP - MORNING The Mutt Cutts van is parked next to a couple rigs and Harry is sitting beside it on the pavement, a BROKEN man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only human, Harry. Anybody can make a mistake. But Harry just sits there, practically catatonic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, man, pull yourself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I got half a mind to just jump on the bus to Europe and say goodbye to your ugly mug forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rolls his eyes) You can't take a bus to Europe, dodo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a passport. Harry lets out a defeated SIGH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, stop being a baby about this. Okay, so we back-tracked a tad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tad? Lloyd, you drove almost a sixth of the way across the country in the wrong direction. Now we don't have enough money to get to Aspen, we on't have enough money to get home, we don't have enough to eat, we don't have enough to sleep!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it doesn't do any good having you sitting there on your butt whining about it. If we're gonna get out of this hole, we're gonna have to dig ourselves out. Harry thinks about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you're absolutely right, Lloyd. He stands up, brushes off his pants, and starts to walk toward the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home. I'm walking home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't be serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Why not? We're probably only five miles away. Harry starts resolutely toward the road while Lloyd watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot, Mr. Perfect. Like you never screwed up. Harry suddenly STOPS IN HIS TRACKS and turns back to his friend. He seems completely rained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, man... I'm sorry. (beat) I never should have let you talk me into this in the first place. You've got a good reason to goo a beautiful girl's waiting for you. But let's face it, Lloyd, there's nothing waiting for me in Aspen. (beat) There's nothing waiting for me anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lloyd just stands there, SPEECHLESS, as Harry turns and walks away. Out of frustration, he BANGS the snout of the car, causing it to BARK. CUT TO: EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY Harry is walking down the highway, his thumb stuck out unenthusiastically. A few cars WHIZ by, the cold wind whipping at his clothes. A station wagon blows by and throws a BAG  OF GARBAGE out the window. It lands at Harry's feet. EXTREME  CLOSE-UP OF HARRY'S FACE - a TEAR slowly rolls down his cheek  (like the Indian in the commercial). PAN DOWN to the bag of  garbage. We see it's a BAG OF ONIONS that's ripped open. Suddenly a HEARSE pulls up and stops. It's an ominous-looking vehicle and Harry hesitates. Then the passenger window rolls down, revealing a contrite Lloyd at the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got room for one more, if you still want to go to Aspen. Harry looks the hearse over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you find this baby?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used car dealer. I   traded the van for it. Plus I got   the guy to throw in fifty bucks for   gas money. (beat) Come on, man, what   do you say? We still partners? HARRY SMILES AND WE CUT TO: EXT. COLORADO STATE LINE - DAY An impatient Detective Dale is still staked-out at the Colorado border with several other officers.
