direction.raw_text: It doesn't make sense. They should've been here hours ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they're smarter than we thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How smart can they be? They're riving a goddamn dog! Another COP rushes over holding his walkie-talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just got a report that they were spotted about two hours ago heading east near Des Moines on I-80.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (incredulous) Des Moines?! Why that's five hundred miles from here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess they got wind of our welcoming party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're wasting time. Let's mobilize. Dt. Dale heads for his cruiser while the other Cops follow. As the officers climb into their cars, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HEARSE - DAY Lloyd is driving and Harry has his feet out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me something, Harry. Would you really have kept going home if I hadn't come back to get you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well let me put it this way, Lloyd: Do you remember when we were Cub Scouts and we got lost in the woods uring that blizzard? We huddled together all night, and we made an oath that if we ever got out of there alive we'd never ever leave each other's side again. Do you remember that? Lloyd thinks hard about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were never Cub Scouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Just then several COP CARS whiz by them in the opposite direction with SIRENS BLARING and LIGHTS FLASHING. When Harry glances back at the cop cars, he notices that there's a COFFIN in the rear of the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this? There's a coffin in the back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, it's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a shit. I'm not driving anywhere with a casket. You know I'm superstitious calm down. We'll dump it off first chance we get. EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY Harry and Lloyd are swerving through traffic in the hearse. Ahead of them is a REAL FUNERAL PROCESSION. The lead car is a CADILLAC. INT. CADILLAC (LEAD CAR) - DAY (This is the car right behind the funeral hearse.) A MAN and a WOMAN are arguing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I married a cheapskate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut your trap, Gerdie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so embarrassed. I'll never be able to show my face again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew something good would come out of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could have given him a more ignified burial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your uncle was a cheap man. Remember what he got us for our twenty-fifth? A friggin' fern. There's no way I'm gonna spend a load to get him planted. EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY While the couple ARGUES ON, Harry and Lloyd cut in front of them. The Man and the Woman on't notice this an soon the ENTIRE FUNERAL PROCESSION IS UNWITTINGLY FOLLOWING THE WRONG HEARSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. PIGGLY WIGGLY SUPERMARKET - DAY Harry and Lloyd pull up to a large green dumpster behind the market. The procession comes to a halt behind them. The guys get out of the hearse and remove the coffin from the back. Then they unceremoniously HEAVE THE COFFIN INTO THE DUMPSTER AND WIPE THEIR HANDS OFF. ON THE LEAD CAR OF THE PROCESSION - The Woman's jaw is practically on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son-of-a-bitch! I want a ivorce!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : QUICK MONTAGE OF THE HEARSE WEAVING IT'S WAY THROUGH THE SCENIC ROCKIES AS WE REPRISE 'MARY'S PRAYER' BY DANNY WILSON. DISSOLVE TO: EXT. MOUNTAIN ROAD - DAY The hearse drives past a sign that says ENTERING ASPEN, COLORADO. CUT TO: EXT. DOWNTOWN ASPEN - DAY The boys stroll down the sidewalk, looking in the windows, studying the passersby, taking in the sights and sounds of the ski town. 69.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this wonderful? What more could a couple of single guys like us ask for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about food and shelter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're so materialistic. (beat) Why don't we get down to business and eliver the briefcase to Mary. Who knows, maybe she'll invite us in for tea and a strumpet or two?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jolly good idea, chap. And where oes the lovely young lady reside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... good question. Harry throws Lloyd a concerned look, but then notices a phone booth next to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well what's her last name? We'll look it up in the phone book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmmm... You know, I don't believe I caught that either. Harry's concern grows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the briefcase, Lloyd? There must've been a name on it, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brightening) Come to think of it, there is. It's engraved right into the leather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samsonite   spelled just like it sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Harry starts flipping through the phone book. Then abruptly HE STOPS and puts the book down, a DEFEATED look on his face. CUT TO: INT. HEARSE - NIGHT The car is parked in a parking lot across the street from a picturesque bridge. Harry and Lloyd are shivering in the front seat as a LOUD, ICY WIND WHIPS though the hearse. They're each spooning something out of a coffee cup and sipping it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any soup left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little. Shall we share it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Lloyd opens a TINY KETCHUP PACKET and squirts half of it into Harry's cup and the other half into his. They pour a few drops of water in and mix it with their spoons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mmmm mmmm good... Lloyd smiles bravely at Harry. Harry notices something and leans toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you got something stuck in your front teeth. Lloyd picks a small speck out of his mouth and studies it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm... looks like an old piece of Beef Jerky. HARRY STARES AT IT. THEN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna split it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're pathetic. Get your own. Loyd puts the floss-meat back in his mouth and chews it. Another gust of wind swirls around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm freezing my ass off, Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roll up your window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is rolled up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I guess the damn anti-cold system isn't working. You really should get it fixed if we're gonna live here all winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What anti-cold system? Lloyd points to the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here the A/C button. I put it on full blast about an hour ago and, if anything, the car's getting colder. Harry stares at Lloyd and then throws down his cup, disgusted. He opens the car door and starts to climb out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going out there for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To warm up. EXT. HEARSE - NIGHT Harry gets out and leans against the car with his arms crossed. Lloyd comes from around the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you worrying about now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm worried about how you're gonna survive the pummeling I'm about to give you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Suddenly Harry LUNGES at Lloyd, who takes off around the other side of the car. Harry leaps across the hood, but Lloyd manages to evade his grasp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, calm down! You're acting like a wild animal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get over here and take your medicine, Lloyd!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, doc, I can't take medicine. I'm a Christian Scientist! Lloyd continues to outrun him around the car. Frustrated, Harry opens the car and PULLS THE BRIEFCASE OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something I should've done a long time ago. This stupid thing has been the root of our problems all along. Harry starts walking toward the bridge spanning a river.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do anything foolish, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Foolish? This is the most sensible thing I've done in years. I'm gonna toss this goddamn curse right into that river. Lloyd starts to follow after Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're making a big mistake, Harry! I'll never forgive you for this! Harry keeps marching toward the bridge, determined to dispose of the briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, hold up! Things are gonna get better, I promise! In fact, I think I feel another piece of Beef Jerky in my left molar! It's yours, Harry, all yours! Harry stops in his tracks, intrigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bluffing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I'm not, man look. Lloyd pulls his cheek back, revealing a molar. Harry squints at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a filling, you liar! Just then, Lloyd makes a dash at Harry. Harry turns and runs, but Lloyd TACKLES HIM as they reach the bridge. The briefcase GOES FLYING, and the guys wrestle pitifully with one another in the snow, rolling over and over. Finally, Harry manages to get the upper hand. He climbs on top and CLASPS HIS HANDS AROUND LLOYD'S THROAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to have a life! A miserable one, but a life, nonetheless! Suddenly Lloyd's EYES LIGHT UP as he sees something O.S. behind his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, look! Harry turns and HIS EYES LIGHT UP, TOO. He lets go of Lloyd as we see THEIR POV - THE BRIEFCASE IS LYING BUSTED OPEN ON THE GROUND, REVEALING STACKS AND STACKS OF BIG, BEAUTIFUL HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. DOWNTOWN ASPEN - NIGHT Harry and Lloyd are hurrying down the sidewalk, clutching the briefcase. The city is lit up with millions of tiny lights, like a fantasy winter wonderland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, here's the plan: We borrow a few bucks just a small loan from the briefcase, and we check into a cheap motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we'll keep track of the money we spend with IOUs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be meticulous    right down to the last penny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That way, whatever we borrow we can pay back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. We're good for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, as soon as we get jobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll come right out of our first paycheck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ELEGANT HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT A tuxedoed Bell Captain, BARNARD, is showing the guys around an ENORMOUS AND LUXURIOUS SUITE. The place is big enough to throw a touchdown bomb in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...This is the Hotel Danbury's Presidential Suite, gentlemen. It's normally reserved for royalty, visiting dignitaries, and illustrious stars of stage and take it. The Bell Captain is a bit taken aback, but pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good, sir. Are there any bags you'd like sent up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Barnard, but we'll find our own chicks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (peevish) I wasn't talking about ladies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Then go ahead and send thim up. What are their names? Barnard SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I meant your luggage. Harry forces a. embarrassed half-smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell you what you can send up, my friend how about some chow? The Bell Captain nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll bring you a menu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't bother. Just order us one of everything. At this, Harry serves Lloyd a reproachful look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of everything? Lloyd... Lloyd looks guilty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sorry. (beat) Make that two of everything. Harry smiles at this as Lloyd pulls a wad of HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS out of his pocket. He rips one off and tucks it in Barnard's top pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here you go, Barney. You keep us happy, we'll keep you happy. The Bell Captain, Barnard, is energized by this tip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir! He bows and leaves the room. Then Lloyd cracks open the briefcase and inserts a SMALL PIECE OF PAPER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (proudly) Our first IOU. Signed and dated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. SWANSON CHALET - NIGHT Helen Swanson is KNOCKING on her step-daughter's bedroom door. She's holding a tray with a couple of mugs on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary? You awake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) COME IN... INT. MARY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Mary is sitting in a chair looking sadly out the French windows when Helen ENTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought you some tea. I thought it might help you relax. Mary smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. She takes a mug, sips, and pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yech! What's in this, whiskey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, sorry... that one's mine. Helen grabs the mug from Mary and hands her the other one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feeling any better, honey? Mary can't take her eyes from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just knowing that Melvin's out there, being held by God knows who... (fighting back tears) It's all my fault. I should've been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. You can't blame yourself for this. If you'd been there they would've taken you, too. Helen pulls out a joint and torches it up. She takes a hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should just pay them the money again and get this thing over with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now Mary, everything that can be done is being done. You've got to stop torturing yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to do? Go about my life as if everything were fine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's exactly what you should do. Get the hell out more, go skiing, socialize. Don't you see, honey? We can't let on that anything is wrong. If the press or authorities get wind of this, the kidnappers might panic. (beat) Who knows what they'd do to poor Melvin then? AS MARY THINKS ABOUT THIS, WE CUT TO: EXT. HOTEL DANBURY - DAY The Guys pull up to the front of the hotel in the hearse. Several HOTEL EMPLOYEES rush to help them. Harry and Lloyd get out wearing OVERLY TRENDY SKI GARB, complete with fur boots, NASA designed goggles, and splashy fluorescent colors everywhere. The Employees all grab the shopping bags and then line up as Lloyd TIPS THEM ALL handsomely. INT. BEDROOM - PRESIDENTIAL SUITE - NIGHT The huge beds are covered in boxes and bags of new goodies. Lloyd is going through it all. Harry is sitting out on the balcony with his feet up on the railing, checking out the mountain view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh god, it's really true. Last night I thought I might've been dreaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no dream, Har. We finally cracked the big time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it was so simple. All it took was somebody else's money. Harry LIGHTS A CIGAR WITH A TWENTY DOLLAR BILL, takes a hearty puff, and EXHALES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Lloyd, I think you might've gone a little overboard with the spending today. He blows out the twenty and tosses it off the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the big deal? We're gonna pay it all back anyway, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, but do you really think you needed to buy those two surfboards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surfboards? I thought those were beginner's skis. This suddenly makes sense to Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh. I was wondering why you had those bindings put on them. Lloyd opens a box and holds up a SCANTY NEGLIGEE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd this come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sheepishly) I bought it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like the feel of it against my skin... (defensive) ...I mean, you know, when a woman's wearing it. Lloyd inspects it more closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, how many women do you know who wear a size XXL?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, leave me alone. I'm rich now. I'm supposed to have a few eccentricities. There's a KNOCK on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enter, parlez vous! The Bell Captain, Barnard, ENTERS with a champagne bucket and a newspaper under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought you your newspaper and some champagne, gentlemen. Unfortunately, we didn't seem to have the, um, label you requested. Lloyd examines the champagne's label and frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All out of Boone's Farm, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a rapier wit, sir. I took the liberty of bringing a comparable substitute: Dom Perignon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess it'll have to do, slugger, eh? Lloyd smiles and over tips him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you so much, sir. He puts the tray down, hands Lloyd the newspaper, and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, one more thing: You can     dispense with the 'sir' crap. Let's     face it, Barney, we're all from the     same mold. (winks) We just have a little more     dough than you right now. Barnard smiles and EXITS. Harry comes back in the room. He picks up a champagne glass and flicks it with his finger, sending out a resonant RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cocktail hour has commenced! He starts to open the champagne bottle as Lloyd begins thumbing through the newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, later on what do you say we...? He notices that Lloyd's mouth has dropped open at something he's found in the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lloyd... you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dumbstruck) Harry, it's her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary with the briefcase. This is her... He shoves the newspaper at Harry. CLOSE ON THE HEADLINE - it reads: SWANSONS TO HOST PRESERVATION GALA TONIGHT; CITY'S ELITE EXPECTED. Underneath this is a photograph of Mary with her parents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary Swanson...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Cinderella, it's time to get you ready for the ball... Roy Orbison's "Pretty Woman" plays over a... MONTAGE OF HARRY AND LLOYD'S GLAMOUR MAKE-OVER:

Suddenly Lloyd grabs his neck as if he's been nicked. BLOOD SQUIRTS OUT from between his fingers. The other CUSTOMERS stare in horror at this. Lloyd LAUGHS and shows everyone a SQUEEZE KETCHUP BOTTLE hidden in his hand. Only Harry and Lloyd seem to find this joke amusing. -We see them getting their nose hairs clipped. She smiles. -Next we see the Oriental Masseuse lying on her stomach with her shirt off, while Harry happily massages her back. -The guys are in an expensive haberdashery. Harry comes out of the dressing room in a very elegant BLACK TUXEDO. He couldn't look any more suave. The Salesman looks on hopefully, but Lloyd again disapproves. -This time Harry comes out in a JUNIOR-PROM-LIKE SKY-BLUE TUXEDO, complete with TACKY FRILLS. direction.raw_text: . EXT. ASPEN PRESERVATION SOCIETY - NIGHT Throngs of GUESTS in black-tie and elegant gowns are entering the building. Suddenly the hearse pulls up with Harry and Lloyd BUMPER SURFING BEHIND IT. Harry's wearing his blue tuxedo. Lloyd's tux isn't any better it's pumpkin orange. (THEY'VE GOT MATCHING TOP HATS AND CANES.) When the hearse stops, the boys hand the driver Barnard a couple hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the lift, Barney. INT. ASPEN PRESERVATION SOCIETY Nicholas Andre is greeting people at the door. However, when Harry and Lloyd try to enter, he stops them and gives them the once over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, gentlemen, but this is a five-hundred-dollar-a-plate dinner. Harry and Lloyd look at each other and shrug. Then Lloyd takes out a WAD OF BILLS and peels off TEN HUNDREDS, much to the amazement of Andre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This should cover a couple plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm kind of hungry, Lloyd. What if we want seconds? Lloyd thinks about this. Then he peels off another thou.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put us down for four plates, my good man. They ENTER the party. As Andre watches them go, his associate J.P. Shay comes up beside him, an alarmed look on his face. J.P. SHAY (WHISPERING) Jesus Christ, boss... it's them. BACK ON HARRY AND LLOYD - the guys make their way through the affluent crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting nervous, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: relax, Lloyd. These people are just like you and me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? They're educated, well-bred, charming, and sophisticated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what? We can be sophistica holy shit, would you look at the fun bags on that hose hound. He points out a busty BLONDE BOMBSHELL entering the party. Lloyd rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't do this to me, Harry. I'm already a wreck. What if Mary oesn't like me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, let's just go saddle up to the bar and down a couple bowls of loudmouth soup. A little booze'll bring back that old Lloyd Christmas over-confidence. The guys stand out at the glittering social scene as they make their way to the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to BARTENDER) Two martinis, straight up. As Harry and Lloyd silently take in the party, a BEAUTIFUL RED HEAD reaches between them for a cocktail napkin, then walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Harry.

direction.raw_text: I didn't say anything.

dialogue.raw_text: : LLOYD'S FANTASY: Lloyd is walking up the steps of a luxurious, snow-covered chalet, carrying Mary's briefcase. The sky is absurdly blue and children are making a snowman on the lawn. It's all out of a dream world. He KNOCKS on the door, tentatively. Mary opens it. She looks at him, then at the briefcase, and breaks into the BIGGEST, SWEETEST SMILE he's ever seen. Then she slowly backs into the house, gesturing for him to follow... Lloyd follows Mary down a hallway. As he trails after her, she pulls off her shirt, revealing her bare back, and glances over her shoulder at him. CAMERA MOVES around a corner and now we're in a STEAMY BATHROOM. The shower is running and we see the silhouette of two people behind the curtain.

direction.raw_text: ) 'That's one fiery bush I wouldn't mind roasting my weenie in.' Harry raises his eyebrows, IMPRESSED.

direction.raw_text: And I would say 'shut up', because this is our chance to get in with the rich and powerful and you don't ingratiate yourself to the kind of people by acting like Ron Jeremy on Spanish Fly. The Bartender delivers their martinis as we hear the o.s. CLINKING of a glass. The guys turns to see Nicholas Andre standing at a podium. Next to him is a LARGE, COVERED DISPLAY. On his other side are Karl and Elizabeth Swanson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I could have your attention, please... The crowd QUIETS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to thank you all for coming to this very special event. As you KNOW, THE ASPEN PRESERVATION SOCIETY - founded and chiefly funded by our great benefactors, Karl and Helen Swanson - is the world's foremost efender of endangered species. Our SPRAWLING GROUNDS ARE HOME TO TWENTY- three separate varieties of animals that are currently listed on the United Nation's charter of protected species. Tonight, we are deeply honored to have Mr. Karl Swanson welcome our twenty-fourth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The crowd CLAPS as Mr. Swanson takes Andre's place at the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the Icelandic Snow Owl. He pulls the cover off, revealing TWO MAJESTIC, FLUFFY WHITE OWLS IN A CAGE. Everyone OOHS and AHHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These magnificent specimens were RESCUED RECENTLY, CULMINATING A FIVE- year, two-million-dollar effort on our part. Together, they constitute one-seventh of the snow owl population left on the planet. ON ANDRE - he's nervously eyeing Harry and Lloyd. He looks pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here these lovely birds will be allowed to breed in a natural but protected habitat. And, God willing, with your help and that of the Society's, we will see these wonderful creatures flourish once more. More APPLAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, thank you, and enjoy your evening. Oh, and feel free to take a closer look at our new friends here. Enjoy. The crowd APPLAUDS and begins to mingle again. Lloyd turns back to the Bartender and holds up his empty glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two more, please. Harry stares at Lloyd with concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lloyd, I've never seen you this uptight. You've gotta chill out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help it. This is a very important night for me. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Harry, have you ever wondered why you and I never have long-term girlfriends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? I went out with Fraida Felcher for two and a half weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a fluke. (beat) The reason we never have long-term girlfriends is because of one thing: We're afraid of the C word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's crazy. We live for the C word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm talking bout commitment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'm ready for commitment, Harry. The first time I laid eyes on Mary Swanson, I knew she was the one. (beat) Some things you feel in your heart, other things you feel in your groin. This girl makes me feel it all in the heart. Suddenly Lloyd notices something across the room. HIS POV - A BEGUILING MARY SWANSON IS TALKING WITH A COUPLE OF GUESTS. SHE'S WEARING A spectacular black cocktail dress. Lloyd quickly turns toward the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit, there she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checking her out) Wow. You weren't kidding, Lloyd. She's an angel. (beat) Well, what are you waiting for? Get over there and talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gonna think I'm some kind of psycho when she realizes how far I came just to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have her briefcase she's gonna be thrilled to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then what? She'll take it back and that'll be it. I'm a nobody. Harry thinks about this a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, man, you just drove two thousand miles to see this girl. Don't quit on the last fifty feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brightening) Wait a second, I have an idea. You go over and introduce yourself. That way you can build me up so when I come along I won't have to brag about myself. Tell her I'm good-looking and I'm rich and I have a rapist's wit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell her you're good looking, Lloyd she's got eyes. Lloyd takes a big gulp of his new martini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please Harry, I'm appealing to you as one loser to another. Just build me up and then give me a signal to come over. Please. Harry SIGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. But you're gonna owe me a big one for this. Harry straightens his polka-dot bow-tie, then APPROACHES Mary, who is now standing alone, admiring the owls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice set of hooters you got there. Mary turns to Harry, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The owls. They're beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Yeah. (beat) Are you a bird lover?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I used to have a parakeet, but my main area of expertise is canines that's dogs to the layperson. She smiles at this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. I love dogs, too. So how are you involved with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I've trained them, bathed them, clipped them; I've even bred them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Any unusual breeding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, mostly just doggie-style. But one time we successfully mated a Bulldog and a Shitzu.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? That's weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. We called it a Bullshit. (breaks out LAUGHING) Just a little breeder joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She seems strangely charmed by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, the real reason I came over is because I want to introduce you to a friend of mine. Just then, Mary's stepmother approaches. She's holding a martini and looking a little sloshed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary, I don't believe I've met your friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, we haven't been introduced yet. (holds out hand) I'm Mary Swanson, and this is my stepmother, Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry Dunne. Pleasure meeting you both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw you come in earlier, Mr. Dunne. I was hoping we'd get a chance to meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taken aback) You were?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That tuxedo I love a man with a sense of humor. So does Mary. Mary shoots Helen a look, then smiles at Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? For a moment, he's caught up in Mary's eyes, but then manages to snap out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, about my friend you doing anything tomorrow, Mr. Dunne? Because I believe Mary's looking for somebody to hit the slopes with. Whuh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen, you're embarrassing me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well you are, aren't you? (to Harry) Poor girl doesn't get out enough. So what do you say, Harry? Are you available? Harry thinks about this, then looks across the room at a hopeful Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I don't know. You see, my friend your friends for one day. You and Mary will have a ball. Mary's captivating eyes meet his, waiting for an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... well... I don't know. You see, the thing is... sure. ON LLOYD - he waits impatiently at the bar as Harry returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you didn't call me over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, you're golden. I got you a ate with her tomorrow. Lloyd falls back against the bar and grabs his chest. He's SPEECHLESS.

direction.raw_text: Wha... you... I... it's... (smiles) I love you, man. I love you! Lloyd clamps an embarrassed Harry in a TIGHT EMBRACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, get a grip, Lloyd. You're making a scene. Lloyd steps back elated.

direction.raw_text: This calls for a toast! He grabs a bottle of champagne out of a bucket and starts to open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna be my best man, Har, I mean it. It was always between you and my future wife's brother, but you just earned a seat at the head table, pal. Suddenly the CORK SHOOTS OUT OF THE CHAMPAGNE BOTTLE AND ZIPS ACROSS THE ROOM LIKE A BULLET   DIRECTLY TOWARD ONE OF THE NOW EVEN WIDER- EYED OWLS. In quick succession we hear a BOK!, a SQUAWK!, and a THUMP! A HUSH falls over the entire party as everyone turns their stunned attention to the cage. THEIR POV - FEATHERS ARE FLOATING IN THE AIR THROUGHOUT THE CAGE, AND ONE OF THE ICELANDIC SNOW Owls LIES ON ITS BACK, its species now one bird closer to extinction. Harry and Lloyd look on in horror. Harry takes the smoking champagne bottle from Lloyd and places it on the bar.

direction.raw_text: (under breath) I think we've done enough hobnobbing, Lloyd. The guys LOWER THEIR HEADS and slink out of the room before anyone can figure out what happened anyone except for Nicholas Andre, that is; we PAN to show that he's been standing nearby watching their every move. And he doesn't look very happy.

direction.raw_text: : INT. AASPEN APARTMENT - NIGHT Nicholas Andre is pacing the room with a drink in his hand while J.P. Shay looks on nervously. J.P. SHAY Maybe it was just a coincidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be stupid. It's a message, plain and simple: We killed their bird, now they killed ours.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't pull that trigger if I were you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? It'll look like just another Aspen love triangle. You caught the two of them in bed, handcuffed them to the post, murdered them, and killed yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smug) Except you're forgetting one minor etail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? Lloyd and Mary look at Harry, hopeful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you kill us, you'd be killing yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (puzzled) Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, philosophers believe that we're all really just tiny pieces of one huge universal being. In other words, I am you and you are me, so if you were to kill us you'd be committing suicide, you unenlightened idiot -- ANDRE --Shut up! Mary sees that they're in deep shit now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about my husband? Did you kill him, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Husband? What husband?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary's married, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to worry about Melvin. (beat) Now this is the last time I'll ask: Who wants to die first? Harry gestures with his head at Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill her. The bitch should've told him she was married back at the airport. It would've saved us a lot of trouble. Andre points the gun at Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll go first, Harry. I was the one who got you into this mess. Andre points the gun at Lloyd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, wait, do me first. I'm the one who stole your girl, Lloyd. I eserve it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Andre SIGHS and points the gun at Harry. Then, as Mary and Lloyd look on in horror, he FIRES TWICE. Harry grabs his stomach and falls off the bed to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! You killed my best friend, you bastard! Andre smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's any consolation, you're about to be reunited. He aims the gun at Lloyd, COCKS THE TRIGGER. Suddenly, a SHOT RINGS OUT and the gun is blown out of Andre's hand. ON THE FLOOR - Harry is very much alive and pointing a pistol at the stunned Nicholas Andre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry! You're alive! Just them, the door BURSTS OPEN and SEVERAL POLICE OFFICERS storm in with their weapons drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your hands up, asshole! Lloyd and Harry throw their hands into the air. A stunned Andre turns to see six guns pointing at his head. He reluctantly raises his hands. Mary and Lloyd are flabbergasted by the turn of events. There's a sudden commotion in the room. Pushing her way through the mass of cops comes the Athletic Beauty. She flashes an ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Special Officer Kathryn Frick. Federal Bureau of Investigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dumbstruck) You gotta be kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work, Harry. Lloyd looks to his friend, confused. Harry opens his shirt, revealing a BULLET-PROOF VEST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She grabbed me down in the lobby and explained what was up. They slapped this on me and gave me a gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Athletic Beauty) But how did you...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been following   you two all the way from Providence.   Mr. and Mrs. Swanson had a homing   device plated in the briefcase. The guys glance guiltily at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, about that dough...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every bill was counterfeit and marked. Harry and Lloyd EXHALE A SIGH OF RELIEF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HOTEL DANBURY - NIGHT There's a swarm of ONLOOKERS as Andre and J.P. Shay are hustled into a police car and driven away. While Mary TALKS to the police, Harry and Lloyd stare at her lovingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's something, ain't she, Har?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were right, Lloyd. She was efinitely worth the trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess we have to admit it, she was too good for us. Just then, a cruiser pulls up and Mary's husband jumps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh god, baby, I missed you! Harry and Lloyd stare in wonder as MEL GIBSON climbs out of the car. Mary and Mel embrace, then Mel turns to the guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't thank you enough, fellas. It was so darn dank in that well, I really thought it would be the death of me. Harry and Lloyd are too stunned to respond. They look at each other, and we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Barney...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, gentlemen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, we just wanted to say that we appreciate all you did for us during our stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we're, um, sorry about the money we gave you turning out to be phony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, gentlemen. The Swanson family has promised to reimburse everyone. This seems to please Lloyd and Harry. The hearse is delivered to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, anyway, thanks again for everything. They turn to go, but Barnard CALLS TO THEM:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you two headed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. I'm sure we'll find a trailer camp somewhere to call home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not right here? Harry and Lloyd look at each other, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This joint is a little out of our budget, Barney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) Oh, I think we might be able to find you a free room somewhere -- after all, like you once told me, we're all from the same mold. (winks) You just don't have any dough right now. The guys are STUNNED by Barnard's generous offer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you on the level?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. We'll just slide you into one of the employee rooms... The guys beam at this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Provided, of course, you don't mind working one or two afternoons a week. Harry and Lloyd lock eyes. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what, Barney, I think we'll take out chances down the road. Barnard shakes his head as the two fools climb into their hearse and drive off. EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY As the hearse drives down the road, we hear V.O.:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TWO MAJESTIC, FLUFFY WHITE OWLS IN A CAGE
TONGUE IMMEDIATELY FUSES WITH THE FROZEN METAL
LLOYD GRUNTS AGAIN, WE CUT TO
LLOYD WATCHING ALL THIS IN DISBELIEF
DUMPS THE ENTIRE PACK INTO ONE MUG AND MIXES IT IN
DRESSED IN A NEW SUIT AND TIE, LLOYD DOES A DOUBLE-
CLICK-CLACK OF A GUN BEING COCKED

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LOBBY - HOTEL DANBURY - THE NEXT DAY Lloyd and Harry come out of the elevator with their meager luggage, but this time nobody rushes to their aid. EXT. HOTEL DANBURY - DAY The guys EXIT the hotel and approach the Bell Captain, Barnard.
